chapter.title: DHIS2 in the Autonomous Region of Kurdistan

para.emphasis: For the thousands of refugees stranded in camps across the war-torn Autonomous Region of Iraqi Kurdistan, getting access to regular health care hasn’t always been straightforward.
Set up in 2015 by the University of Rome Tor Vergata (Italy) with the Ministry of Health of Kurdistan Regional Government (KRG).
Funded by the Cooperation and Development Agency of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Italy.p
130,000 health events registered so far in the system.
Bilingual English and Kurdish-Sorani DHIS2 interface.

section.para: In June 2015, a DHIS2 Health Information System was set up to assist the Kurdish health authorities in collecting population data and improving the access and quality of public health care.

A KRG DHIS2 pilot project led by the University of Tor Vergata, Rome, and realized by IPRO and Euresist was deployed across a set of pilot health centers and hospitals in the Kurdish directorates of Erbil, Duhok and Slemani.

With 60 registered users spread across 30 health centers, Kurdish medical professionals can now follow a staggering 150,000 health events! Indeed, just 16 months into the pilot project, there are now 7 primary/family health centers, 9 hospitals, and 14 general health centers, 10 health centers in rural areas or small towns/villages, and 20 health centers in major towns.

100,000 cases have been imported via periodic uploads from existing and running databases, and 50,000 cases have been recorded by DHIS2 users. This great progress is enabling health professionals to gather statistics for disease diagnoses, hospital discharges, registrations of births, deaths and immunizations.

The project is also using the WHO’s International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10), which is the standard diagnostic tool for epidemiology, health management and clinical purposes. So far, over 700 doctors and nurses have received specialized ICD-10 training and epidemiological surveillance training.
You can see a YouTube video of the project here: Kurdistan Region, DHIS2 Health Monitoring System - October 2016.
